column4: Doesn't someone know how to make a shell script with an infinite loop run in the system boot without it stopping the system boot!?
back up, what are you wanting to do in broad terms?
I'm tring to execute a plugin called nsca_check that communicates with a server and passes info to it
the information is used by a monitoring program to check the status of a service (http, ftp, etc)
look into nagios or a similar package, sounds like that's the sort of monitoring you're trying to do
at the very least, look into how they hook into the system
the problem is I need to do some checks from the client machine every X minutes
so i need kind of a daemon or something similar
I believe nagios has provisions to do exactly that, but the simplest approach would be to use cron like Titan8990 said
you can make a cron job to run something periodically
can i make cron start my script at system startup?
im on it ^_^ thanks Titan8990 and cwillu  ^_^
